title: Apple braced for $862m bill over patent battle defeat
text:
Welcome to your preview of The Times Subscribe now Apple braced for $862m bill over patent battle defeat Apple denied its processors infringed patents and argued that the patent was invalid Getty Images James Dean Technology Correspondent Last updated at 10:23AM, October 14 2015 
Apple faces a bill of $862 million after a jury decided that it infringed a patent for microchip technology used in its iPhones. 
A jury in Madison, Wisconsin found yesterday that Apple used the patented technology, owned by the licensing arm of the Wisconsin Alumni Research Foundation (WARF), without permission. 
WARF sued Apple in January 2014 alleging infringement of its 1998 patent for improving chip efficiency. 
The court will now determine exactly how much Apple owes in damages, and whether it wilfully violated the patent, which could enlarge the penalty. 
Apple and the Wisconsin Alumni Research Foundation did not immediately Subscribe now
